intro: Geonoma densa, commonly known as the dense fern, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its dense, overlapping leaves that form a rosette shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by berries containing seeds. Geonoma densa thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Its foliage is used in traditional medicine and as a decorative plant in horticulture.
